Working with Light Sources
Using the eRnsT Viewer
Global Properties
 
Using the eRnsT Viewer > 

Setting Properties

 
 
 

When viewing a scene in the eRnsT interface, you can experiment with the effect of setting different properties for your light sources, for the scene in general, and for the shape instances (or game objects) that you have added to your scene. You can view and modify these properties on the tabs in the properties pane, on the right side of the eRnsT interface.

The pages in this section detail the different configuration settings exposed in these tabs.

Savable settings

Each of the settings described in these pages also indicates whether or not the value you set is "savable":

  • If a setting is marked as not savable, the value you set cannot be saved into your scene. Any changes you make will not be baked into your lightmaps, and the next time you launch eRnsT the setting will be reset to its default value.
  • If a setting is marked as savable, the Beast API is capable of reading the value set in the eRnsT session and updating the scene accordingly. Therefore, changes you make to these settings may or may not be saved and persisted to future eRnsT sessions, depending on how eRnsT is integrated into your level editor.

Topics in this section

  • Global Properties
  • Properties for Light Sources
  • Properties for Shape Instances
  • Properties for Cameras
